title: Fix crash issue on winning a game
message:
Fix crash issue on winning a game

mPersistStatsAsyncTask was being run twice in cases where you won a game, which causes a crash (below). Switching to a separate HandlerThread and posting a Runnable prevents this from being a problem and ensures that each persist call is done sequentially.

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot execute task: the task has already been executed (a task can be executed only once)
at android.os.AsyncTask.executeOnExecutor(AsyncTask.java:579)
at android.os.AsyncTask.execute(AsyncTask.java:535)
at com.github.triplesolitaire.TripleSolitaireActivity.a(SourceFile:458)
at com.github.triplesolitaire.TripleSolitaireActivity.a(SourceFile:61)
at com.google.android.gms.common.api.l.b(Unknown Source)
at com.google.android.gms.common.api.l.handleMessage(Unknown Source)
at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)
at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:135)
at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5221)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:372)
at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:899)
at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:694)

title: Remove race condition on Event updating, ensure correct update increment
message:
Remove race condition on Event updating, ensure correct update increment

As Event updating only occurred after a database operation, it was possible to hit 'New Game' before it completed, leading to an error as the GoogleApiClient was no longer connected. Also the value that was being used was the number of games played since last sync, rather than the number of games _won_ since last sync.

Due to stylistic cropping on social networks (such as Google+'s circular cropping in many places), the default icon graphic gets cropped off badly. This adds a full bleed version of the icon more appropriate for those social networks.

title: Ensures that 0 duration games are treated as losses.
message:
Ensures that 0 duration games are treated as losses.

Replaces 0 duration games with null duration games to accurately reflect the intent that losses should have no duration. This corrects the issue in the Provider upgrade from version 1 to 2 which turned null durations into 0 duration games (which were treated as wins).

title: Improves the share message when you have no wins.

Improves the share message when you have no wins.

Previously with no wins you were sharing that you had MAX_INT time for a best time - this replaces that message with a more appropriate message.

title: Updates version number
message: Updates version number

title: Reordered resources to ensure base layouts are for the smallest supported screens
message:
Reordered resources to ensure base layouts are for the smallest supported screens

Both layout/layout-port distinctions were due to lack of horizontal space. Converted to using layout for the base (smaller horizontal width) layouts and layout-w720dp for the larger horizontal width layouts. This ensures that both landscape and portrait 10" layouts are the same.

Note that we need to use layout aliases in this case to ensure that Android 3.1 devices are not adversely affected.

title: Updates screenshots to reflect newly added G+ Share button
message: Updates screenshots to reflect newly added G+ Share button

title: Removes PreferenceManager.setDefaultValues to ensure Preferences are restored
message:
Removes PreferenceManager.setDefaultValues to ensure Preferences are restored

PreferenceManager.setDefaultValues overrides preferences restored by TripleSolitaireBackupAgent. Turns out that we don't necessarily need to call setDefaultValues (as all of our preference gets use the default values if the values are not found).

message:
Target API 13 to allow use of home button in main activity.

When targeting API14+, you have to specifically enable the Home button
and show the up arrow. Since we use the Home button on the main activity
as an alternate pause button (/ About Window), we want to target API13
to keep it in compatibility mode.

title: Fixes GH-31 - Multiple games are started on launch.
message:
Fixes GH-31 - Multiple games are started on launch.

Code to detect statistic resets caused two games to be created on game launch (as onResume method thought that the current game was removed when in fact it just wasn't in the database yet).

title: Fixes GH-22 - Autoplay option not hiding when overlapping with Progress Bar. Due…
message:
Fixes GH-22 - Autoplay option not hiding when overlapping with Progress Bar. Due to functionality in Android per [this bug](http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=16530), the action bar menu items will take up as much as half of the screen before auto hiding, no matter if custom views/tabs take up more than half of the space. To solve the issue in TripleSolitaire, created a custom layout for the progress bar so that it takes up less horizontal space in portrait mode.

Signed-off-by: Ian Lake <ian.hannibal.lake@gmail.com>

title: Fixes GH-19 - Timer Starts Before First Move After Selecting "New Game" as well…
message:
Fixes GH-19 - Timer Starts Before First Move After Selecting "New Game" as well as related issue where timer would go at double or faster speeds due to multiple increment processes running simultaneously. Also fixes pausing in general - pause is based on window focus, so opening a menu or looking at a notification pauses the game.

Signed-off-by: Ian Lake <ian.hannibal.lake@gmail.com>

title: Fixes GH-3 - Game crashes when Autoplay when won is on. Issue was tied to…
message:
Fixes GH-3 - Game crashes when Autoplay when won is on. Issue was tied to starting the auto play by tapping a card in a cascade or the waste and the drag event not finishing before the animation started, causing a ConcurrentModificationException. Added a slight pause of 10ms and a post to ensure the drag event finishes.
